p: Expected ecosystem responses to climate change include altered fire regimes (e.g. [ 1– 3]), insect outbreaks (e.g. [ 4]), hydrologic changes (e.g. [ 5]), altered nutrient cycling (e.g. [ 6]), species range shifts (e.g. [ 7– 9]), and novel species assemblages (e.g. [ 10– 11]). Vegetation models have been used to simulate such changes and provide resource managers projections to help their decision process [ 12]. Estimating associated uncertainty allows managers to modulate their strategies [ 12].
